text: French patent No. 245,032 was filed for appareil servant a l'obtention et a la vision des epreuves chrono-photographiques, AKA the Cinematographe, a combined motion-picture camera and projector.

ENIAC (the Electronic Numerical Integrator and Calculator) the first practical, all-electronic computer was unveiled at the University of Pennsylvania's Moore School of Electronics. The New York Times carried the report the next day.
Microsoft gave the first public look at their new version of Windows, called Windows XP, formerly codenamed Whistler.
